definition: fine time, lucky day (idiom); fig. good opportunity
5th earthly branch: 7-9 a.m., 3rd solar month (5th April-4th May), year of the Dragon/ancient Chinese compass point: 120°
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.chinese: 恭喜恭喜，今天可是個良辰吉日啊。

sentences.english: Well, will there are any sunday in June which fall on a chinese auspicious day?
sentences.chinese: 嗯，六月有沒有良辰吉日的星期天呢？

sentences.english: Well, will there be any Sunday in June which falls on a Chinese auspicious day?
sentences.chinese: 嗯，六月有沒有良辰吉日的星期天呢？

definition: to send the betrothal gifts/(fig.) to conclude a marriage
to fix a date (for an event)/to select an auspicious date
to worship heaven and earth/ritual kneeling by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/also called 拜堂
one's birth data for astrological purposes, combined from year, month, day, hour, heavenly trunk and earthly branch
ritual kneeling to heaven and earth by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/same as 拜天地
congratulations on house-moving or promotion (idiom); Best wishes for your new home!
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
